nodes.name: MNase
nodes.description: Information about the position of Nucleosomes along the genome, generally obtained using MNase-seq method, but also using other related techniques.

nodes.name: RNA-seq
nodes.description: Data on the relative expression of genes of a particular cell population, obtained by sequencing RNA transcripts extracted from cells.

nodes.name: Histone marks
nodes.description: Data on epigenetic histone modifications (in particular methylation of their N-terminal tails), typically obtained using ChIP-seq.

nodes.name: Hi-C
nodes.description: Matrices encoding contact probabilities between loci along a portion of a genome, obtained using techniques derived from chromosome conformation capture, such as Hi-C.

nodes.name: Models (bp)
nodes.description: Physical models of chromatin at the base-pair resolution, encoding the elastic properties and interactions of naked DNA and nucleosomes, to describe the behaviour of several thousand bps.

nodes.name: 3D chromatin
nodes.description: Three-dimensional structures of chromatin, generally predicted on the basis of contact matrices.

nodes.name: ChIP-seq
nodes.description: Information on the genome sequences to which a DNA-binding protein is bound in the cell.

nodes.name: Models (kbp)
nodes.description: Physical models of chromatin at the kilo-base-pair resolution, used to describe the epigenetic-dependent mechanics and interactions of chromatin segments of several million bps.

nodes.name: DNA MD
nodes.description: Time-dependent behaviour of DNA and protein-DNA complexes, obtained using Molecular Dynamics with an underlying physical model, giving access to space- and time-resolved information on the complex.

nodes.name: FISH
nodes.description: Microscopy imaging data obtained by marking with fluorescent probes specific regions of the genome, used to identify the (relative) location of genome segments in the cell.
